Today I presided over a meeting of the Council of Ministers, during which we approved a specialized training program for all teachers and teachers in the State schools https://t.co/cYNp0fLKh8

We have adopted a program to evaluate government hospitals according to criteria such as waiting times, level of satisfaction and success rate of operations. Evaluation reports will be published to the public
We have also adopted the establishment of the International Forum of Halal Credit Organizations, which will seek to promote international trade in the Halal industry
The consumer product market is only $ 237 billion in the Middle East and North Africa, and we intend to achieve state leadership in this area
We have also adopted a federal road lighting project with a low-power LEDs system that will achieve 50% reduction in energy consumption in street lamps

As I stated yesterday morning at my press conference. I look forward to the Presidential debate. The debate is not about individuals.
The Presidential debate is about putting yourself out there to be questioned by the people. Whether it is 10 people or 100,000.
From statistics available, there are almost 30% of households in Uganda that have television sets.
This means that an average of 6 million citizens watch TV. Of these 2.5 million are voters. Leadership is about setting new standards.
Leadership is also about recognizing that the interaction you have with citizens may cause them to view things differently.
I view the debate as for television purpose yes, but it may spur on one or ten people to go out and ask for a UG that works for everyone.
